name: 'C' the Art Terms, Be the Art Terms Online Trivia | Humanities | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following is a term for a free-standing bell tower?
questions.explanation:
Campanile.

	Campana is the Italian word for bell...so if you knew that, this question was a cinch!  If you ever come to UC Berkeley, pay a visit to the campanile there, the world's 3rd largest.  Also called Sather Tower, it's a great place to get a view of the entire bay area.

questions.text: Which of these C terms is the female counterpart of 'Atlantes'?
questions.explanation:
Caryatids.

	Atlantes and Caryatids are human figures that can be found along columns in Ancient Greek architecture.

questions.text: The term 'Carolingian' refers to the arts promoted during the reign of which monarch and his successors?
questions.explanation:
Charlemagne.

	'Carolingian' also refers to the dynasty founded by Charlemagne which ruled the Holy Roman Empire from the 8th to the 10th centuries.  Carolingian art was basically a classical revivalist movement...with a German touch.

questions.text: This is an art movement associated with Russian artists such as Gabo, Pevsner and Tatlin.  Name it!
questions.explanation:
Constructivism.

	The movement, founded in 1913, focused on imitation of the modern forms and processes of the technological world.  I think my favorite Constructivist artist is Naum Gabo who created seemingly delicate sculptural pieces with nylon string.

questions.text: One of these terms refers to an asymetrical painting pose in which the subject's body parts twist away from one another, but which one?
questions.explanation:
Contrapposto.

	In a contrapposto pose, the subject's lower body and upper body twist in opposite directions.  The term contrapposto is from the Italian for 'to contrast' or 'set opposite'...makes perfect sense!

questions.text: Capital, Stylobate and Shaft are all terms associated with which architectural construct that starts with C?
questions.explanation:
Column.

	A classical column consists of a Capital, Shaft and Base, and rests on a Stylobate.

questions.text: Kurt Schwitters is most associated with which art form?
questions.explanation:
Collage.

	Schwitters, a German artist, was a member of the Dada movement.  He was not the originator of the collage, but he did develop variations on it using discarded rubbish in order to create pictures.

questions.text: Which of these pairs of artists are most associated with the use of Chiaroscuro?
questions.explanation:
Rembrandt and Caravaggio.

	Chiaroscuro is a style of painting that deals with contrasting degrees of tones and shading.  Rembrandt and Caravaggio were two masters of this craft.

questions.text: What was the very first camera called?
questions.explanation:
Camera obscura.

	A camera obscura employed a lens or small hole to throw an image upon a flat surface.  A camera lucida was an innovation on the camera obscura, employing a prism rather than a lens.

questions.text: The calotype was an early process invented by which pioneer of photography?
questions.explanation:
Talbot.

	William Henry Fox Talbot first patented this process in 1840, the first photographic process that utilized a negative to produce an image on paper.
